enWisdom: The bane of the soul is being infatuated with this world

Wisdom: سَبَبُ صَلَاحِ النَّفْسِ الْعُزُوفُ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: Turning away from [the pleasures of] this world is the means of reforming the soul

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ عَرَفَ نَفْسَهُ كَيْفَ يَأْنَسُ بِدَارِ الْفَنَاءِ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who knows himself, how can he feel at ease in the temporary abode [of this world]?!

Wisdom: مَنْ صَحَّتْ مَعْرِفَتُهُ انْصَرَفَتْ عَنِ الْعَالَمِ الْفَانِي نَفْسُهُ وَهِمَّتُهُ
enWisdom: One whose cognizance is sound, his soul and his endeavour turns away from the evanescent world

Wisdom: مَا كَرُمَتْ عَلَى عَبْدٍ نَفْسُهُ إِلَّا هَانَتِ الدُّنْيَا فِي عَيْنِهِ
enWisdom: No servant considers his soul to be honourable but that the world becomes lowly [and insignificant] in his eyes

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ عَلِمَ شَرَفَ نَفْسِهِ أَنْ يُنَزِّهَهَا عَنْ دَنَاءَةِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: It behoves the one who knows the honour [and value] of his soul to purify it from the lowliness of this world

Wisdom: إِيَّاكُمْ وَغَلَبَةَ الدُّنْيَا عَلَى أَنْفُسِكُمْ فَإِنَّ عَاجِلَهَا نَغْصَةٌ وَآجِلَهَا غُصَّةٌ
enWisdom: Do not let this world get the better of you, for indeed its present is bitter and its future is distressful
